0 = x^4 - 4x^3 - 7x^2 + 36x - 45

This is a quartic polynomial equation, and finding the exact roots can be quite challenging. However, we can try to find the possible rational roots using the Rational Root Theorem.

The Rational Root Theorem states that if a rational number p/q is a root of the polynomial, then p is a factor of the constant term (in this case, -45) and q is a factor of the leading coefficient (in this case, 1).

Factors of -45: ±1, ±3, ±5, ±9, ±15, ±45
